title: Inside the Good Morning Britain presenters' weddings - from Piers' posh do to Kate's romantic nuptials
text:

Many of the Good Morning Britain presenters are happily married.

Piers Morgan, Kate Garraway, Ben Shephard and Charlotte Hawkins are just a few of the famous faces who regularly share their anniversary celebrations and big days on social media.

Let's take a trip down memory lane and look back at their stunning wedding days.

Piers Morgan

Piers Morgan married fellow journalist Celia Walden in 2010 in Oxfordshire.

During an appearance on Lorraine this summer, Piers revealed Celia had forgotten their anniversary every single year since they tied the knot.

The controversial host said: "She's forgotten it for nine consecutive years! It's just like I'm not in her airspace at all!

"So I have a wife who just never remembers our anniversary. So I remembered I gave her a card."

Celia, who has daughter Elise with Piers, whilst he also has three sons with his first wife, recently took to Instagram to share a sweet throwback snap from their wedding day.

She wrote: "Nine years ago today - he just reminded me" followed by the hashtags "#happyanniversary #sorryiforgotagain".

While Piers marked the anniversary by writing: "My most brilliant achievement was my ability to persuade my wife to marry me' – Sir Winston Churchill. I concur with that sentiment, succeeding in that achievement 8yrs ago today."

Kate Garraway

Another presenter who appeared to forget the anniversary of her nuptials was GMB host Kate Garraway .

Kate married former political advisor Derek Draper in 2005.

She shared a sweet photo from her big day showing Kate and Derek smiling blissfully and covered in confetti.

She wrote: "When you are on your way home from a night out & you realise your husband has posted this wonderful thing on Facebook and you totally forgot it was your anniversary. Do I sneak in quietly?!"

Ben Shephard

Ben tied the knot in March 2004, to Annie Perks following a nine-year relationship.

The couple have since welcomed their two sons, Jack and Sam, and share a beautiful family life together, which Ben often shares glimpses of on Instagram.

Earlier this year, the telly presenter announced that he was stepping down from his long-running role on Goals to spend more time at home.

He also previously joked that another way he's kept his marriage happy was by turning down an offer to do Strictly Come Dancing .

In 2017, Ben shared a sweet anniversary post writing: "13 years ago today I somehow managed to persuade Annie to say yes. Still amazes me to this day that she did. I'm very lucky - I do miss those SuperNoodles though."

Laura Tobin

Laura Tobin has been married to Dean Brown since 2010.

In 2017, the GMB meteorologist announced live on air that she was expecting her first child and later welcomed a baby girl, Charlotte Blossom.

Speaking of her student days in the Daily Mirror, Laura previously said: "The thing about Dean was he didn’t become too intense, send me loads of flowers, and he didn’t love me more than anything on Earth."

The couple recently celebrated their anniversary.

Laura wrote: "Time flies-9 years ago today I got Married. Happy Anniversary to my wonderful husband. It's so nice to reminisce about the day.

"It was amazing, so much love & laughter with all our favourite people, including my beautiful bridesmaids

"I LOVED my Princess dress & cascading bouquet of orchids. I wish I could do it all over again."

Alex Beresford

Alex is married to Natalie Beresford and the couple have a son named Cruz.

Alex, Natalia and Cruz are always away enjoying tropical holidays.

The couple have kept the details of their big day under wraps, but here is a photo of them looking glammed up for a friend's wedding in 2018.

Charlotte Hawkins

Charlotte Hawkins married her fiancé Mark Herbert in 2008 in the stunning location of Chichester Cathedral.

Last year, the newsreader and her husband Mark celebrated their 10th wedding anniversary at Raymond Blanc's Belmond Le Manoir Aux Quat'Saisons in Oxford.

The loved-up couple also share four-year-old daughter Ella Rose.

Charlotte marked the special occasion with a sweet post dedicated to her husband.

She wrote: "Happy 10th wedding anniversary to my fabulous husband! Love you lots - thank you for always being there for me"

"We are celebrating with a magical stay at @belmondmanoir - big thanks to the team for making it so special. Ella Rose has decided she wants to move in".
description: We take a look at the way Piers Morgan, Kate Garraway, Ben Shephard and the rest of the GMB gang celebrated their big days
